{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question describes a patient with a positive blood culture for Gram-positive cocci that are catalase positive and coagulase negative. Gram-positive cocci that are catalase positive include Staphylococcus species. The coagulase test differentiates Staphylococcus aureus (coagulase positive) from coagulase-negative Staphylococci (CoNS). The most common CoNS that causes infections, especially in patients with indwelling medical devices such as a CVP line, is Staphylococcus epidermidis.", "answer_choice": "B. Staph. epidermidis"}
